I am wondering why you like to hardcode the version number... cause when I debug in the mysql driver, I found that there are a lot of different version checkings for different mysql functions.I am not sure if the 5.6.4 is the highest version number in all the driver source code, for timestamp format itself,it is 5.6.4,but for others, some lower, some maybe higher, I think the most safty way is to check the version agains the mysql server in the proxy startup and combine with your proxy version then set to your constant parameter?
maybe you have your own concern, this is just my opinion...
If SQL without sharding key, what behaviour do you expect except route to all data nodes?

Can you provide the log of `sql.show` for the incorrect one?
And the version 3.x is out of service, can you try 4.x again?
Does anybody interest with this issue?
I just close this one, let's talk about #3572
I am interesting, pls assign to me.
Hello, I wonder if I can add a property to control whether to take the full route, or throw an exception to abort such a request that no shard condition, or let the developer handle it.

I understand your concern.

Actually, I checked all the versions as a condition in Connector/J, only 5.6.4 will cause critical troubles. That's why I chose this version.

To explain why hardcode the version number, here are the reasons:

1. Databases mananged by one Sharding-Proxy instance may have different versions, there's no restricted conditions of the version consistency. In the inconsistent condition, which version should we choose?

2. Sharding-Proxy does not have different behaviors under different versions. Although we support alterable versions this time, we can't support alterable behaviors. For example, Sharding-Proxy didn't support MySQL protocol before 4.1.

3. It is not worthy to announce 'Sharding-Proxy can't work if the database versions aren't consistent' just for this issue.

Anyway, I welcome you to submit a pull request, maybe your solution is better, we can discuss more there.
This requirement is made because we do not want to make changes at the orm layer.

ok, incase you have checked all the versions in Connector/J, it would be enough for this momenet.
Well, for the moment, I don't have a deep knowlege of this sharding product. I am only a new user to this and considering to use this proxy in production if all the test passed ^_^

It is not a good idea to let user to handle by programing with SQL problem by themselves.
How many users can understand this feature? 
ShardingSphere is not an orm framework, it is a database.

hello ,I know that sharding-jdbc is not a orm,it is a enhanced version of a jdbc driver,I wonder if it is possible to abort the query at this level if SQL does not have a shard key，or let developer handle it that no shard key,more flexible,As my question above,route to all data nodes could consume a lot of database resources and cause business damage.
Any good suggestions?

Hi,
After recompile the source code and test, the insert of the sql with timestamp works ok, I have check the value in the real table, it contains the milliseconds. but when read from the proxy, it miss the milliseconds again.
When I debug the mysql jdbc driver, I found that the value of the length of timestamp field in internalRowData of com.mysql.jdbc.ByteArrayRow are different when connnecting to proxy and database directly.
the length of the value of the timestamp field is 19 when connecting to sharding-proxy
the length of the value of the timestamp field is 23 when connecting to the database directly
I do think there is still a bug in the sharding-proxy for the timestamp value
mysql is no problem，so this is oracle third-party problem..Maybe we shoud wait oracle version updating.this issue should think again or again, etc.
How to deal with sharding-proxy？

## About how to calculate realtime data sync delay second
1. Create a table with timestamp column in source database.
1. Sharding scaling timing update the timestamp column with current timestamp.
1. Read the timestamp value from log, use current timestamp subtract the value, result is the delay second.

This solution support MySQL and PostgreSQL.

Hi, will close soon if no response anymore.

ShardingSphere should like a database, not a java SDK. sharding-proxy and sharding-jdbc are 2 different access adaptor.
We don't consider about make them diff for the core feature.
Your feature request is for SQL audit.
We have no plan to do SQL audit for now.

> now i change my sql , if sharding column is null ,donot insert.

Is it a correct behaviour for regular database? For my understanding, only add a column constraint as `NOT NULL`, then database should not permit the tuple insert into the table.

> Can you change the `Fixes #issue` to `For #issue`, I think this PR can't fix issue completely.

OK.

In my opinion, the `stop` interface should not use DELETE method, because this interface only stop the scaling job.

What's more all interface can add `/job/` prefix like 
```
/shardingscaling/job/start [POST]
/shardingscaling/job/progress/${jobId} [GET]
/shardingscaling/job/stop [POST]
```

> In my opinion, the `stop` interface should not use DELETE method, because this interface only stop the scaling job.
> 
> What's more all interface can add `/job/` prefix like
> 
> ```
> /shardingscaling/job/start [POST]
> /shardingscaling/job/progress/${jobId} [GET]
> /shardingscaling/job/stop [POST]
> ```

Agree. The apis will be these.

Hi, They are some PRs maybe can clear up your confusion. (https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/pull/3354, https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere/pull/3150)
As you know, Nacos registry center can not support proxy util now. Are you interest in this ?

The exception is thrown form SQLServer, can you google the exception first?

`The value is not set for the parameter number 1.`

The exception is `[Inline strategy cannot support range sharding.]`

So please do not use Inline strategy with range sharding, you can use java strategy for your range sharding.

Please resolve the conflict in your app scope.
Maven can help you to analyze the conflict.

Sharding proxy needs to be configured in Nacos in advance.（#3354）

Config-sharding.yaml ->schemaName: sharding_db
schemaName field value needs to be configured to Nacos in advance.

> Which data node should the data inserted into?

i use ComplexShardingStrategy   , tenant_id and consumer_id can known data,  
and  tenant_id + consumer_id correspond only id_number.  i save Map when insert have id_number.

so i use tenant_id,consumer_id,id_number as sharding column, 
if  where tenant_id=1 and consumer_id=*   sharding is ok

if where id_number=*      

first : find by map get tenant_id and consumer_id  second: cal databases

that my questions.

Configure  .orchestration_ds.config.schema field to Nacos configuration center
such as：key->.orchestration_ds.config.schema  value-> schemaName1, schemaName2, schemaName3
